page.title: 11A VISIT TO SWANCOTE FARM
page.content: On June 12th Chaddesley Corbett School went to Swancote Farm. First we saw a big shed and Mr. Spencer led us in. We saw 5 cows getting ready to be milked. Then we saw the milking machine and Mr. Spencer got the suckers and put them on the cows udders and they pulled out the milk that went into the big containers. When the milk is all out of the cow it gets sucked up the pipes and goes through the wall into the big milk tanks ready for when the big lorry comes to take the milk away. When we got out of the shed we saw a little bull all on his own and his name was Marco Polo because he likes polo mints. Then we went to see two calves and we saw them eating and drinking milk out of a bucket. Then we went to see the crops. We saw barley and wheat and some straw. We saw a dog named Tegan and he likes chasing birds
